title: Another American Pie film? Jason Biggs and Shannon Elizabeth are keen
text:
Another American Pie? (Picture: Rex Features)

When every other film and TV is getting a reboot, you might as well throw American Pie in the mix, as far as lead star Jason Biggs is concerned.

Even though we’ve had many a fill of pie, the Jim Levenstein actor has thrown his pants into the ring for another spin around the franchise.

And he’s been joined by Shannon Elizabeth (who played Nadia in the original).

As the pair headed to the Jay And Silent Bob Reboot (see, another reboot) at TCL Chinese Theatre this week, they shared their excitement at any opportunity to take another slice of pie.

‘I am always down. You will never hear from me any reluctance, but I haven’t heard anything for a little while,’ Jason said, as per We Got This Covered.

Shannon played Jim’s not-really love interest (Picture: Rex Features)

‘It is the most fun I have ever had working on anything. I love that cast, and I love that role.’

He added, with what we can only assume was a twinkle in his eye: ‘A lot of things have to come together for it to happen, but fingers crossed it will.’

Shannon chimed in with her own thoughts, as she added: ‘Look, I think reboots are great because you can get a new generation, a young cast, that is doing the film, but you make it modern and it works for this day and age.

Jason is up for it (Picture: WireImage)

‘So, I never think that is a bad thing.’

Eh, we’re a pessimistic bunch but even we’d be keen to see where Stifler has ended up after all this time.

Back in July the film’s cast reunited on the 20th anniversary, which would have been a perfect time to start etching out the script, don’t you think?

In an epic selfie most of the gang have come together, including Jason, Alyson Hannigan (Michelle), Seann William Scott (Stifler), Chris Klein (Oz), Tara Reid (Vicky) and Natasha Lyonne (Jessica) – with the snap no doubt sending fans wild.

Luckily for us, the selfie was in aid of a two-part reunion special the cast had been filming for Entertainment Tonight.

While their baby faces might now be gone, they’ll forever live on screen in American Pie’s four movies; American Pie, American Pie 2, American Wedding and American Reunion.

Sure there were a couple of spin-offs too, but they were tossed aside like that one time at band camp because let’s face it American Pie just isn’t American Pie without Jim and his, let’s say, astonishingly bad luck.

Guess we’ll just watch this space.
